name: Artistic Partition
statement: For two positive integers $$$l$$$ and $$$r$$$ ($$$l \le r$$$) let $$$c(l, r)$$$ denote the number of integer pairs $$$(i, j)$$$ such that $$$l \le i \le j \le r$$$ and $$$\operatorname{gcd}(i, j) \ge l$$$. Here, $$$\operatorname{gcd}(i, j)$$$ is the greatest common divisor (GCD) of integers $$$i$$$ and $$$j$$$. YouKn0wWho has two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$k$$$ where $$$1 \le k \le n$$$. Let $$$f(n, k)$$$ denote the minimum of $$$\sum\limits_{i=1}^{k}{c(x_i+1,x_{i+1})}$$$ over all integer sequences $$$0=x_1 \lt x_2 \lt \ldots \lt x_{k} \lt x_{k+1}=n$$$. Help YouKn0wWho find $$$f(n, k)$$$.
inputFormat: The first line contains a single integer $$$t$$$ ($$$1 \le t \le 3 \cdot 10^5$$$) — the number of test cases. The first and only line of each test case contains two integers $$$n$$$ and $$$k$$$ ($$$1 \le k \le n \le 10^5$$$).
outputFormat: For each test case, print a single integer — $$$f(n, k)$$$.
